title: 'Whoever signed off England's tour has to go' - Agnew column
summary: England's 4-1 Ashes defeat is the most disappointing I have covered and whoever signed off on the tourists' preparation has to go, writes Jonathan Agnew.

title: Carey hits four to seal five-wicket win for Australia
summary: Alex Carey secures victory in style for Australia, as he hits a four to seal a five-wicket win against England on day five of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney, as Australia win the series 4-1.

title: 'He's a yard short!' - Labuschagne run out as England show late fight
summary: Marnus Labuschagne is run out for 37 after some excellent fielding from Matthew Potts as Australia fall to 121-5, chasing 160 to win on day five of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

title: Best player, moment & back spasm - our Ashes awards
summary: Best player, best moment, best back spasm and services to tourism. Who wins BBC chief cricket reporter Stephan Shemilt's Ashes awards?

title: Who made your Ashes team of the series?
summary: Find out which players made the cut into the BBC Sport team of the series for the Ashes.

title: England beaten to give Australia 4-1 Ashes win
summary: Australia complete a nervy five-wicket victory over England on day five of the final Ashes Test in Sydney to seal a 4-1 series win.

title: England futures at risk but Head an all-format star - player ratings
summary: Find out who got a 10 and who is facing an uncertain international future with our Ashes player ratings.

title: 'That has spun a mile' - Smith stunned by brilliant Jacks delivery
summary: Australia captain Steve Smith is left stunned as he's bowled by a brilliant delivery from Will Jacks for 12, leaving Australia on 92-3, needing 68 runs to win the fifth and final Ashes Test in Sydney.

title: 'It's had a shocker' - Snicko controversy strikes England again
summary: England find themselves on the wrong side of another controversial Snicko decision after Jake Weatherald is given not out despite there appearing to be a murmur on the Snicko technology, as the ball passes the bat - with Weatherald on 16 and Australia 33-0, chasing 160 to win the fifth and final Asâ€¦

title: Brilliant Brazilian and defying the odds - Brentford's European charge
summary: With four wins in five games, and a Brazilian striker banging in the goals, Brentford fans are dreaming of the Champions League.

title: Rumoured Solskjaer return to Man Utd 'seems ridiculous'
summary: Match of the Day pundits Danny Murphy and Stephen Warnock look at who should take charge at Manchester United following Ruben Amorim's departure earlier this week.

title: Fletcher to take charge for FA Cup - but Man Utd problems far bigger
summary: Darren Fletcher will remain in charge of Manchester United for their FA Cup match against Brighton - as the club battle problems that go far deeper than sorting out managerial uncertainty.

title: 'A wonderful innings' - Bethell's brilliant knock ended by Starc
summary: Jacob Bethell's memorable innings comes to an end as he's caught for 154 by Alex Carey, off the bowling of Mitchell Starc to leave England 328-9, with a lead of 146 on day five of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

title: An Arsenal coffee cup and more pain for under-pressure Frank
summary: Spurs boss Thomas Frank under more pressure and scrutiny after holding Arsenal-branded cup before 3-2 defeat by Bournemouth that left side 14th in Premier League.

title: Wilson will have his 'pick of clubs' - MOTD's Murphy
summary: Match of the Day's Danny Murphy analyses Fulham's Harry Wilson's current form and "intelligent" winning performance against Chelsea.

title: Former England boss Keegan diagnosed with cancer
summary: Former England striker and manager Kevin Keegan has been diagnosed with cancer and is receiving treatment.

title: Discipline, consistency & harmony - Rosenior's to-do list at Chelsea
summary: New Chelsea head coach Liam Rosenior was optimistic when arriving, but Wednesday's 2-1 defeat at Fulham underlines the scale of the task ahead.

title: Newcastle score twice in stoppage time to win seven-goal thriller
summary: Harvey Barnes scores twice as Newcastle come from behind to beat Leeds in a dramatic seven-goal thriller at St James' Park.

title: Traces of Leonardo da Vinciâ€™s DNA May Have Been Discovered on a Red Chalk Drawing Called â€˜Holy Childâ€™
summary: Researchers suggest that they have recovered sequences from ancient works and from letters that may belong to the Renaissance genius.

title: 'Like a movie' - Semenyo enjoys fairytale farewell
summary: Antoine Semenyo could not have dreamed of a better ending to his Bournemouth career as his late winner against Spurs ends the Cherries' long winless run.

title: Man Utd did more than enough to win - Fletcher
summary: Manchester United Interim manager Darren Fletcher says they created enough chances to have beaten Burnley after their 2-2 draw at Turf Moor.

title: Palace hold on to deny Villa victory in hardâ€‘fought draw

summary: It's Ghoul-approved.

summary: Bournemouth are keen on bringing in Ethan Nwaneri from Arsenal, Crystal Palace boss Oliver Glasner set to hold talks over extending deal, AC Milan keen on Liverpool defender Joe Gomez, plus more.

title: Costco's Newest Deli Item Has Fans Rejoicing: 'About Time!!'
summary: It's basically MADE for meal prep.

title: Sesko scores twice but Burnley fight back to hold Man Utd
